Reason: The _journalSizeThreshold configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the size of the journal file created by the PersistentJournal, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Setting a higher threshold may result in larger journal files, increasing memory consumption and potentially impacting disk I/O performance. On the other hand, setting a lower threshold may result in more frequent journal file creations, potentially affecting the execution time of the application. Therefore, the configuration involves performance-related operations that are memory-expensive and time-expensive within its related code, making it performance-sensitive.
